intro: Rhamnus utilis var. multinervis, commonly known as the many-nerved buckthorn, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its dense, thorny branches and small, oval-shaped leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in clusters, followed by dark blue berries that are edible for birds and some mammals. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
